descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this introductory music class, students will develop tools for describing, interpreting, and evaluating music as it relates to politics, race, class, gender, and other aspects of culture and identity, with a primary focus on the United States. Beginning with foundational knowledge gained through analysis of music as it relates to current events, the class will expand these dialogues to investigate other historical moments through music. Students will be evaluated through journals, attendance and participation, and a final project involving research into music chosen by the individual student.
